node.title: Motel emergency housing a 'stopgap measure', Ardern says
node.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says emergency accommodation is a "stopgap measure" and is concerned about its long-term social effects.

node.title: UK police to investigate Prince Charles' charity
node.description: The metropolitan police are investigating claims Prince Charles' charity offered honours help to a Saudi citizen.

node.title: Death toll from flooding and mudslides in Brazil passes 100
node.description: Almost 400 people were left homeless and 24 people were recovered alive, an official said.

node.title: Wall Street opens lower as investors eye Fed and Ukraine risks
node.description: Concerns about rising interest rates and potential conflict with Russia are weighing on sentiment.

node.title: Russia expels U.S. embassy's second-in-command amid Ukraine tensions
node.description: Bart Gorman, the U.S. deputy chief of mission to Russia, was expelled from the Russian capital on Thursday, the State Department said.

node.title: Inside the night that led to Kat West's mysterious death
node.description: Authorities who investigated the death of the 42-year-old stay-at-home mom retraced not only the night of her death, but also her online life.

node.title: Watch Live: Secretary of state speaks at U.N. on Russia's "threat to peace and security"
node.description: He is speaking as the U.S. says evidence shows Russia is "moving toward an imminent​" Ukraine invasion.

node.title: Watch Live: Amir Locke's funeral held at church in Minneapolis
node.description: The 22-year-old's death has provoked an outcry against no-knock warrants.

node.title: Jobless claims rise for the first time in a month
node.description: The number of Americans applying for unemployment aid ticked up, but economists say labor market remains healthy.

node.title: Millions in path of winter storm, forecast to bring "multiple hazards"
node.description: People from Oklahoma to Maine could get hit with wintry weather.

node.title: At least 13 wedding guests fall into well and die in India
node.description: The celebration turned tragic when a concrete slab covering an old well collapsed under their weight, authorities said.

node.title: Kamila Valieva takes fourth place in women's figure skating competition
node.description: Valieva's fourth-place finish allows for a medal ceremony to take place.

node.title: Monkey brain chips research involving Elon Musk company drawing fire
node.description: Monkeys at the UC Davis primate center had chips made by Neuralink implanted in their brains. Animal rights activists charge that the research in abusive and sometimes ends in death.

node.title: For Victoria's Secret model with Down syndrome, it's "a dream come true"
node.description: "For me, the most important thing about fulfilling my dreams is to show people around the world that there are no limits and to inspire them to pursue their own dreams," Sofía Jirau says on her website.

node.title: Judge says Palin jurors knew he planned to toss claim before they delivered verdict
node.description: The judge said the jurors told a law clerk it didn't affect the outcome.

node.title: Russian ally Belarus says it could host nuclear weapons if threatened
node.description: Day before meeting Putin and amid joint war games on Ukraine's border, President Alexander Lukashenko, also says Russian weapons could remain in his country.

node.title: Lenders pushed high-interest puppy loans across U.S., group says
node.description: Buyers of pricey puppies were baited into loans with annual interest charges approaching 190%, reports National Consumer Law Center.

node.title: Rescuers race against time to reach boy trapped in Afghan well 2 days
node.description: The effort comes less than two weeks after a similar attempt to rescue a child from a Moroccan well gripped the world -- but ended with the boy found dead.

node.title: Ukraine and Russian-backed rebels accuse each other of shelling
node.description: War has simmered in eastern Ukraine for almost 8 years, but with the U.S. accusing Russia of adding, not removing forces in the region, the crisis "can ignite at any moment."

node.title: Fatal shark attack closes Sydney beaches as great white is sought
node.description: The shark is believed to be 10 feet long. It was the first fatal shark attack in Australia's largest city since 1963.

node.title: Keeping pool only 'lipstick' for suburb - deputy mayor
node.description: Napier councillors are divided on whether the city's ageing and outdated pool should be closed.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 1573 new community cases
node.description: The Ministry of Health is reporting 1573 new community cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand today.

node.title: NZ nurses overworked and exhausted - report
node.description: A major independent report has found nurses are overworked and exhausted because of consistent understaffing and that patients are not always getting full care.

node.title: No dialogue with protesters until blockade clears
node.description: All parties in Parliament have united under a clear declaration to the protesters outside - there will be no dialogue while illegal activity persists.

node.title: Canada beats U.S. 3-2 to win women's hockey gold at Beijing Games
node.description: The Canadians took back the gold the U.S. had grabbed from them at the 2018 Pyeongchang Games.

node.title: Visa application software needs clear oversight  - advocates
node.description: Immigration and human rights lawyers say there needs to be clear oversight of the software Immigration New Zealand is using to help process visa applications.

node.title: Stock market operator NZX reports 15% drop in full year profit
node.description: Chief executive Mark Peterson said the drop in profit was a result of a lower return on investments and increased costs, including ongoing investment in technology.

node.title: Canada beats U.S. 3-2 to win women's ice hockey gold at Beijing Games
node.description: The Canadians took back the gold the U.S. had grabbed from them at the 2018 Pyeongchang Games.

node.title: Negotiations for NZ taking refugees from Australia ongoing
node.description: Australian's Home Affairs essentially says there is an "in principle deal" - but the NZ government is staying mum about any significant progress on acceptance of a long standing offer to take 150…

node.title: 'The law has failed': Cranmer Square residents say protesters camping illegally
node.description: Cranmer Square residents say Christchurch City Council is quick to send notices for branches hanging outside their property, but is sitting quiet while protesters are on their doorstep.
